result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary W Simon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1569  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent & must have functioning IID.
Sobrietor in home 1st 6 mo upon release from jail.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Concur to 15CT705.  Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply.

miscConds.notes: All other conditions are the same as count 1 (except jail time).
$243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 1 (except jail time).

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Judgment of conviction prepared.

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.

BMP Violation Report

Status conference at 10-26-2015 01:30 pm

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - Defendant shall not be at any establishment that has the primary purpose of selling or serving alcohol.
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 12:00 P.M. (noon) today (9/28/15).
  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1,000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 5

Defendant appeared.  Cara J Throckmorton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
